contents.text: 序一：在我看过的同材料中，
此件是富得最好的
沈克
管之先生的无比群的内蒙古文革史终于要间世了，秘我首次有幸去请那一大插沉句句的手稿的那一刻——那时个人电腾在中国遗十分军见——我就一直默默地期待着遍一天的到来。

请本书的初稿就给我留下了趣为深刻的印象，而你，积爱的者，看到的则是一部经过修改、重慧以及知性升级的必的大部头·作者的学是如此地令人敬畏，以至于我营年不能不理取其中的一部份，竭毒所能将其成一部未定稿的小册子—《内蒙古的文化大革命：选于一部尚未发表的愿史著作》。作者署名W.Woody·抽出版后，西方研究现代中国最槿威的学术刊物《中国季刊》发表了一篇售部，封抽做了较高的部价·该今高止，该书部仍是唯一一篇剑对一部「未定稿小册子」而不是正规的「售登载在《中国季刊》上的文章·这一事实充份地就明了将这一被期待的史善付粹所具有的重要意义。
尊之的著作不懂在文革文就上填补了封一个特殊的政治、社会以及民族夜雅性地区的空白，而且在中央奥地方、民族奥民族之间的开像的学循研究方面也具有令人晒目的贡感。
在中国内外，人付常，最好的文革研究在海外，因为那裹的中外学者都生活在一个很特殊的智力境——即所西方丁。我徒来不相信种法，管之于内蒙古文革的著作，以及他对文革典中国电影的保的研究证明了这一点·欧洲的学者很少有人能像他那檬对生了甚磨」有全局性的知：亚像他那梯敏地分析出遗些都意味着甚座」。
毛东曾就遇，致力于维世界和平的中瑞雨国人民有着共同的望·我想说，回额磨史，我们同享有另一种共同的渴望：忠实地记缘墨史，亚将其给后人·正是在这一点上：我相信道本普具有鞋以诱大的价值：它是最具权威的座史，它有经通研究后需出的引人入腾的生勤故事，它的置证根据重比泰山。
隆德大学语言与文学中心
2007年8月2日附原英文序
IntrductionAt last！

Qi Zhi's definitive history of the Cultural Revolution in InnerMongolia is about to reach a wider audience.I have silently anticipatedthis moment ever since I first enjoyed the privilege of reading the heftybundle of handwritten manuscript pages it consisted of back in an age whenpersonal computers were still few and far between in China.

So impressedwasIby that first text-which has since been amendedreworked，and intellectually upgraded to become the Must Read Tome thatyou，dear reader，hold in your hands-and so awed by the scholarship of itsauthor thatIwas compelled to produce arough translation of parts ofit，andto the best of my knowledge The Cultural Revolution in Inner Mongolia.Extracts from an Unpublished History by W.Woody" is still the onlyhumble ”occasional paper” ever to be the subiect of a book review proper inthat most authoritative forum of foreign scholarship on modern China，TheChina Quarterly.
The positive review of the "extracts spoke volumes of the importanceOf the complete history then anticipated and now finally appearing.

Qi Zhi's work fills not only a major gap in the Iiterature on theCultural Revolution in a region of exceptional political，social，and ethniocomplexity，but also constitutes a provocative contribution generally to theliterature on central-local and inter-ethnic relations in China.

Itis often said.inside as well as outside the People's Republic，thatthe finest scholarship on the Cultural Revolution is being done overseas，by Chinese and non-Chinese scholars working in the privileged intellectualenvironment of the virtual "West.”

Ihave always believed this not to be true，and Qi Zhi's work on InnerMongolia， as well as his no less impressive research on how the CulturalRevolution impacted on China's flm industryhas been one of the reasonswhy.Only very rarely are we in Europe able to match his degree ofencyclopaedic knowledge of “what happened" with perceptive analyses ofwwhat it all means.”

Mao Zedong once observed.looking toward the future，that the peopleof Sweden and China share the same desire-for world peace.Lookingtoward the past，I suspect we share something else too，namely a desire tosee our histories truthfully recorded and handed down to those who mayone day think of us as their ancestors.It is on this point that Ibelieve thatthe value of this bookis difficult to exaggerate:itis "definitive" history asits best，an engrossing thick narrative meticulously researched and made torest on an evidential foundation as heavy as Mount Tai.
Professor MICHAEL SCHOENHALS
Centre for languages and literature，
Lund University
